text: Defining operator precedence We introduce precedence levels to set operator priorities. For each precedence level we introduce a new nonterminal. S+S8+T|T T+Fx+T|F Fâ€”n|(S) T stands for term, F stands for factor. Now an expression is a sum S of terms. Each term is a product of factors. A factor can be a numeral or a parenthesized sum. We use parentheses to override the precedence rules. If we really want 3 + 2 + 4 to mean a product of 3+ 2 and 4, we must write (3+ 2) x 4.
